node.title: Ed Sheeran, Streaming Star, Is No. 1 With Help From Album Sales
node.alt: Ed Sheeran’s “=” had the equivalent of 118,000 sales in the United States, including nearly 62 million streams and 68,000 copies sold as a complete package.
node.description: Sheeran’s “=” (pronounced “equals”), opens at the top of the Billboard 200 with modest streaming numbers for a star of his magnitude.
node.content: ["Ed Sheeran may be one of the world\u2019s most popular artists on music streaming services, but his latest turn at No. 1 owes a lot to old-fashioned album sales.", "Sheeran\u2019s new album, \u201c=\u201d (pronounced \u201cequals\u201d), opens at the top of the Billboard chart with the equivalent of 118,000 sales in the United States, including nearly 62 million streams and 68,000 copies sold as a complete package, according to MRC Data, Billboard\u2019s tracking arm.", "Those numbers are modest for a star of Sheeran\u2019s magnitude. He draws 76.8 million listeners a month on Spotify, more than any other artist except Justin Bieber, and Sheeran\u2019s 2017 song \u201cShape of You\u201d is that service\u2019s biggest hit ever, with 2.96 billion streams worldwide. (Its music video also has 5.5 billion views on YouTube.)", "Yet the 62 million clicks for \u201c=\u201d is the least number of streams for any new title at No. 1 this year, and streaming overall accounts for only about 39 percent of its total consumption in the United States. Of the 68,000 copies that were sold as complete packages, 33,000 were digital downloads, 26,000 were CDs and 9,000 were vinyl LPs, according to MRC.", "Also this week, Drake\u2019s \u201cCertified Lover Boy\u201d falls one spot to No. 2, Morgan Wallen\u2019s \u201cDangerous: The Double Album\u201d is No. 3, and Doja Cat\u2019s \u201cPlanet Her\u201d is No. 4. Megan Thee Stallion\u2019s \u201cSomething for Thee Hotties,\u201d a compilation of stray tracks, opens at No. 5 with the equivalent of 39,000 sales.", "On the singles chart, Adele\u2019s \u201cEasy on Me\u201d holds at No. 1 for a third week, while anticipation in the music industry builds for her new album, \u201c30,\u201d due Nov. 19."]
